alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 02 at 3:15AM HST until January 03 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI NIIHAU OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY STARTING THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large northwest swell (310-320 degrees) spreading down the island chain will produce dangerously large surf along most north and west facing shores of the smaller islands through early Tuesday morning. In addition, the swell is also expected to produce elevated surf along exposed west facing shores of the Big Island starting this afternoon. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet this afternoon, and 7 to 10 feet tonight. * WHERE...Along west facing shores of the Big Island exposed to a northwest swell. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
